Expectation1: Teaching children moral values and discipline
Situation1: The child is caught stealing snacks at a store, and the step-parent needs to handle the situation
Expectation2: Maintain a safe and O39ean work environment.
Situation2: You notice a small, contained liquid spill in a walkway that needs to be O39eaned up immediately to prevent slips.
Story: I was at the grocery store with my stepson, trying to keep an eye on him while mentally running through the list of supplies I needed for tomorrow’s shift. Suddenly, I saw him slip a candy bar into his pocket. My heart dropped. As his step-parent, I knew I had to teach him right from wrong, to show him that stealing was unacceptable. But just as I was about to confront him, my phone buzzed—a text from my foreman. There was a spill at the site, and I was the only one nearby who could clean it up before someone got hurt. I could picture the slick, dangerous walkway and the expectation that I’d always keep the site safe. I stood frozen, torn between my duty to guide my stepson and my responsibility to my crew. Both roles demanded my immediate attention, and I felt the weight of failing either one pressing down on me.
